alert.note: Alert for Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 5:29PM EDT until May 20 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN OCEAN AND EASTERN MONMOUTH COUNTIES... At 529 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Sandy Hook to near Tinton Falls to near Freewood Acres, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Middletown, Howell, Tinton Falls, Red Bank, Manasquan, Highlands, Point Pleasant Beach, Farmingdale, Allenwood, Elberon, Ramtown, Navesink, Collingwood Park, Lincroft, Freewood Acres, Point Pleasant and Eatontown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 24 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 93 and 114. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central and southern New Jersey. These are dangerous storms. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
